intro: Galium sieheanum, commonly known as the Siehean wood-sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial with opposite, simple, and usually hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in cymes, which bloom in early summer. Its fruits are small, three-lobed berries that contain several seeds. Galium sieheanum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
